New Records: Buddy Hield broke his own record for most made threes in the first five games with a new team in NBA history with four made threes on Wednesday night
Key Match Events: The Warriors scored the first six points of the night and never looked back
Draymond Green scored eight straight points for the Warriors in the second frame
Buddy Hield finished the game with a team-high 21 points, including a 26-foot buzzer beat to close the first half
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights provided in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Steve Kerr was interviewed post-game, but there are no specific quotes or reflections on the match outcome
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors closed out their three-game homestand and will open up a five-game road trip on Saturday night against the Houston Rockets
Buddy Hield's buzzer-beating shot was featured in a video highlight
Draymond Green recorded five blocks on the night, his most in a game since Oct. 28, 2021
Others: Lindy Waters III got his first career start as a Warrior, and the second of his career
Brandin Podziemski finished with a near triple-double, recording 13 points, eight rebounds and seven assists
